sources.title: A Man Betrayed
sources.description: “Strange mix of comedy and drama” “Pleasantly surprised” “Suffers from mood swings” “Charming performance” (IMDB reviews quotes). It tries to be a romantic comedy; it tries be a political drama; it tries to be a screwball comedy; it tries to be a crime drama, and although it’s not quite any of these things, and in spite of the flaws in its bipolar screenplay, it is an entertaining movie with a solid cast and good A-feature production values. Go figure. IMDB rating 6.1. Directed by John H Auer. Released in 1941. Complete Print. AKA “Wheel of Fortune”

sources.title: 1941 A Man Betrayed La Rueda De La Fortuna John H. Auer Vose
A Man Betrayed
sources.description: Bucolic lawyer John Wayne takes on big-city corruption in A Man Betrayed. He sets out to prove that an above-suspicion politician is actually a crook. The price of integrity is sweet in this instance, since Wayne happens to be in love with the politician's daughter. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/a-man-betrayed-1941/

sources.title: Amb5558798142
sources.description: Title: A Man Betrayed Summary: A small-town attorney comes to the city to investigate the murder of a friend and falls in love with the daughter of the crime ring he hopes to expose. Directed by: John H. Auer Actors: Production Company: Republic Pictures (I) Release Date: 7 March 1941 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Country lawyer Lynn Hollister comes to the city to investigate the murder of a friend found shot after spending the evening in The Inferno, a night club that fronts for an illicit gambling operation. It is covertly run by an affable but corrupt politician, 'Boss' Tom Cameron, who uses voter fraud to maintain influence on city hall and the governor's mansion. Hollister learns that his friend was a winner in a dice game on the night of the murder and threatened exposure of Cameron's vice racket. Complications arise when other underworld forces vie to take over Cameron's operation, and Holister falls in love with Cameron's beautiful daughter.

metadata.Plot: Country lawyer Lynn Hollister comes to the city to investigate the murder of a friend found shot after spending the evening in The Inferno, a night club that fronts for an illicit gambling operation. It is covertly run by an affable but corrupt politician, 'Boss' Tom Cameron, who uses voter fraud to maintain influence on city hall and the governor's mansion. Hollister learns that his friend was a winner in a dice game on the night of the murder and threatened exposure of Cameron's vice racket. Complications arise when other underworld forces vie to take over Cameron's operation, and Holister falls in love with Cameron's beautiful daughter.
metadata.Writer: Isabel Dawn, Jack Moffitt, Tom Kilpatrick
metadata.Actors: John Wayne, Frances Dee, Edward Ellis
